ARABIC: إِن تُعَذِّبْهُمْ فَإِنَّهُمْ عِبَادُكَ وَإِن تَغْفِرْ لَهُمْ فَإِنَّكَ أَنتَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: If You punish them, they are Your slaves. If you forgive them, You are the Almighty, the All-Wise.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: If You punish them, indeed they are Your creatures; if You pardon them, indeed You are mighty and wise."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: If You chastise them, they are Your servants; and if You forgive them, You are the All-Mighty, the All-Wise."'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: You may punish Your servants or forgive them for You are Majestic and Wise."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “If you punish them, then indeed they are Your slaves; and if you forgive them, then indeed You only are the Almighty, the Wise.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: If You punish them, they are Your servants, and if You forgive them, verily You, only You are the Almighty, the All-Wise."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: If Thou shouldst chastise them, then surely they are Thy servants; and if Thou shouldst forgive them, then surely Thou art the Mighty, the Wise.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: If Thou chastisest them, they are Thy servants; if Thou forgivest them, Thou art the All-mighty, the All-wise.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: If Thou punish them, lo! they are Thy slaves, and if Thou forgive them (lo! they are Thy slaves). Lo! Thou, only Thou, art the Mighty, the Wise.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and if You punish them, they are surely Your servants; and if You forgive them, You are surely the Mighty and Wise."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Shouldst Thou torment them, then verily they are Thine creatures; and shouldst Thou forgive them, then verily Thou! Thow art the Mighty, the Wise.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: If You punish them, they are indeed Your creatures; but if You forgive them, You are indeed the All-mighty, the All-wise.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: If Thou dost punish them, they are Thy servant: If Thou dost forgive them, Thou art the Exalted in power, the Wise."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: If You punish them, they are Your slaves, and if You forgive them, verily You, only You are the All-Mighty, the All-Wise."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: If You punish them (for their disbelief), they surely are Your subjects; and if You forgive them, surely You are the Almighty, the Wise'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: If You punish them, they are Your servants; but if You forgive them, You are the Mighty and Wise.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: If You should punish them - indeed they are Your servants; but if You forgive them - indeed it is You who is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [5:118] If you chastise them, that is, those among them who are fixed upon disbelief, verily they are Your servants, and You are their Master, disposing of them as You will: there can be no objection to [what] You [do]; and if You forgive them, that is, those of them who are believers, You, only You, are the Mighty, in His affair, the Wise’, in His actions.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (If Thou punish them, lo! they are Thy slaves, and if Thou forgive them (lo! they are Your slaves). Lo! Thou, only Thou art the Mighty, the Wise). This verse has already been explained.
